TADALAFIL

  • Pregnancy
  • Hepatic impairment
  • Renal impairment

  • Side effects

  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Pulmonary arterial hypertension,

By mouth

  • For adults
    40 mg once daily.

Erectile dysfunction,

By mouth

  • For adults
    Initially 10 mg once daily (max. per dose 20 mg), to be taken at least 30 minutes before sexual activity, subsequent doses adjusted according to response, the effect of intermittent dosing may persist for longer than 24 hours, daily dose of 10–20mg not recommended; maximum 1 dose per day.

Erectile dysfunction; for patients who anticipate sexual activity at least twice a week,

By mouth

  • For adults
    5 mg once daily, reduced to 2.5 mg once daily, adjusted according to response, the effect of intermittent dosing may persist for longer than 24 hours.

Benign prostatic hyperplasia,

By mouth

  • For adults
    5 mg once daily.

Advice when patient is pregnant

Manufacturer advises avoid.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

For pulmonary arterial hypertension use initial dose of 20 mg once daily in mild to moderate impairment.

Use maximum dose of 10 mg in erectile dysfunction and benign prostatic hyperplasia.

When used for pulmonary arterial hypertension, avoid in severe impairment.

Manufacturer advises caution in severe impairment and for regular once-daily dosing in erectile dysfunction and benign prostatic hyperplasia—no information available.

Advice regarding renal impairment

In pulmonary arterial hypertension for patients with mild to moderate impairment, initially use 20 mg once daily, increased to 40 mg once daily if tolerated.

For erectile dysfunction and benign prostatic hyperplasia, maximum dose 10 mg if eGFR less than 30 mL/minute/1.73 m2 (avoid regular once-daily dosing).

In pulmonary arterial hypertension, avoid in severe impairment.

Contra indications

  • History of non-arteritic anterior ischaemic optic neuropathy

Known side effects

General side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: Back pain, dyspepsia, flushing, headache, myalgia, nausea, vomiting,

uncommon: Hypertension, tachycardia,

notKnown: Arrhythmia, myocardial infarction, non-arteritic anterior ischaemic optic neuropathy (stop drug if sudden visual impairment occurs), retinal vascular occlusion, sudden hearing loss (discontinue drug and seek medical advice), unstable angina,

Specific side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: dizziness, migraine, nasal congestion, visual disturbances, dizziness, migraine, nasal congestion, visual disturbances, blurred vision, chest pain, epistaxis, facial oedema, gastro-oesophageal reflux, hypotension, increased uterine bleeding, limb pain, nasopharyngitis, palpitation, rash,

uncommon: epistaxis, hypotension, painful red eyes, palpitation, epistaxis, hypotension, painful red eyes, palpitation, amnesia, hyperhidrosis, priapism, seizures,

rare: facial oedema, hypersensitivity reactions, priapism, rash, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, syncope, facial oedema, hypersensitivity reactions, priapism, rash, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, syncope,

notKnown: abdominal pain, increased sweating, seizures, serious cardiovascular events, transient amnesia, abdominal pain, increased sweating, seizures, serious cardiovascular events, transient amnesia, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, stroke, visual field defect,

National funding/access decisions

Cautions regarding administration

  • When used for benign prostatic hyperplasia: anatomical deformation of the penis (e.g. angulation, cavernosal fibrosis, Peyronie’s disease)
  • When used for benign prostatic hyperplasia: cardiovascular disease
  • When used for benign prostatic hyperplasia: left ventricular outflow obstruction
  • When used for benign prostatic hyperplasia: predisposition to priapism (e.g. in sickle-cell disease, multiple myeloma, or leukaemia)
  • When used for erectile dysfunction: anatomical deformation of the penis (e.g. angulation, cavernosal fibrosis, Peyronie’s disease)
  • When used for erectile dysfunction: cardiovascular disease
  • When used for erectile dysfunction: left ventricular outflow obstruction
  • When used for erectile dysfunction: predisposition to priapism (e.g. in sickle-cell disease, multiple myeloma, or leukaemia)
  • When used for pulmonary arterial hypertension: anatomical deformation of the penis
  • When used for pulmonary arterial hypertension: aortic and mitral valve disease
  • When used for pulmonary arterial hypertension: congestive cardiomyopathy
  • When used for pulmonary arterial hypertension: coronary artery disease
  • When used for pulmonary arterial hypertension: hereditary degenerative retinal disorders
  • When used for pulmonary arterial hypertension: hypotension (avoid if systolic blood pressure below 90 mmHg)
  • When used for pulmonary arterial hypertension: left ventricular dysfunction
  • When used for pulmonary arterial hypertension: life-threatening arrhythmias
  • When used for pulmonary arterial hypertension: pericardial constriction
  • When used for pulmonary arterial hypertension: predisposition to priapism
  • When used for pulmonary arterial hypertension: pulmonary veno-occlusive disease
  • When used for pulmonary arterial hypertension: uncontrolled hypertension

Prepared medicinal forms of TADALAFIL

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Tablet
